speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Thank you for calling ISS Insurance Ltd. My name is Sarah. How may I help you today?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Yes, I need to sort out travel insurance. Don't waste my time, I expect comprehensive coverage. I've been with ISS for ages.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Of course, I can certainly help gather your requirements for a travel insurance quote. Could you please tell me where you'll be traveling to?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: We're planning a trip to Europe. Finally getting away.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Europe, noted. And how long will the trip be?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: It will be a 3 weeks trip. Starting from Singapore, obviously.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, a three-week trip to Europe from Singapore. And how many people will be traveling?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Just two of us. We're mostly around 41-55 years old, if that makes a difference to your forms.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Thank you. And are there any particular activities you plan to participate in during your trip?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Yes, we plan to do Scuba Diving. I expect that to be fully covered, not some basic mention. Injuries happen, and that needs proper coverage under the sports and adventure section.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Alright, noted: Scuba Diving coverage required. Are there any specific health considerations or medical equipment needed for either traveler?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: No specific equipment needed. However, my partner has high blood pressure. Does that complicate things? Whatever the case, I expect it to be factored in. We absolutely need solid medical coverage for emergencies – doctor visits, hospital stays, the works. Can't be caught out by huge bills overseas.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, I've noted the need for comprehensive medical coverage and the mention of high blood pressure. Regarding other potential issues, what are your main concerns about the journey itself or your belongings?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Look, things go wrong. I need cover if my luggage gets lost or damaged by those baggage handlers. And delays! If it's delayed significantly, I expect compensation for buying essentials. It's ridiculous waiting around. So, Lost and Damaged Luggage cover is a must.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Understood, coverage for lost, damaged, or delayed luggage. What about the trip plan itself? Any concerns about potential disruptions before or during travel?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Absolutely. This trip costs a fortune. If something major happens – one of us gets seriously ill beforehand, or some major incident cancels flights – I need Trip Cancellation coverage to get my money back. Don't tell me "change of mind" isn't covered, I know that, but genuine emergencies must be. And flight delays are practically guaranteed these days. If we're stuck somewhere because of a long delay, I expect the insurance to cover extra hotel nights and meals. Travel delay coverage is non-negotiable.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, Trip Cancellation and Travel Delay coverage requirements noted. Are there any other specific policy features or benefits you're looking for?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Yes, one more thing. It might sound grim, but I need clarity. I want to know if the policy provides extra coverage, specifically double the payout for accidental death, if the worst happens while traveling on public transport like a bus or train over there. That specific benefit needs to be included. Don't just give me a standard policy; check for this. My budget is flexible, so get me the right plan, not the cheapest.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Understood regarding the requirement for double indemnity for accidental death specifically on public transport. Let me quickly summarize the requirements you've outlined for your three-week trip to Europe for two travelers, aged 41-55, departing from Singapore. You require: Comprehensive Medical Coverage, including consideration for high blood pressure; coverage for Lost, Damaged, or Delayed Luggage; Trip Cancellation protection; Travel Delay benefits; Sports and Adventure coverage specifically for Scuba Diving; and confirmation on the inclusion of a double payout for accidental death if it occurs on public transport. Is that all correct?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Yes, that covers the main points. Make sure those are all properly addressed in the options you find. Don't come back with policies that miss these key things.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Thank you for confirming. I have noted all your requirements. We will use this information to identify suitable plans. Someone from our policy advisory team will be in touch shortly to discuss the options based on these specific needs.

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Fine. Make it quick. Goodbye.
